intro: Viola lilacina, commonly known as the lilac violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of violet to lilac-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils in partial shade. Its flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Viola lilacina is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
